activities.name: Seasons of My Heart – Cooking Class
activities.notes: Hands-on Oaxacan cuisine class.

activities.name: Mercado 20 de Noviembre
activities.notes: Classic food hall; tlayudas and carnes asadas. Town shop – browsing only; authenticity varies.

activities.name: Museo Textil de Oaxaca
activities.notes: Exhibits of Oaxacan textiles; small donations.

activities.name: Restaurante Catedral
activities.notes: Traditional Oaxacan menu near the cathedral.

activities.name: Sabina Sabe
activities.notes: Cocktails and mezcal bar.

activities.name: Casa Oaxaca el Restaurante
activities.notes: Contemporary Oaxacan tasting menu.

activities.name: Zona Arqueológica de Monte Albán
activities.notes: Major Zapotec site on a hilltop.

activities.name: Zona Arqueológica de Mitla
activities.notes: Mosaic fretwork; beyond 25 mi from Centro.

activities.name: Jardín Etnobotánico de Oaxaca
activities.notes: Guided tours; English schedules vary.

activities.name: Mezcaloteca
activities.notes: Guided mezcal tastings by reservation.

activities.name: Hotel Azul (example)
activities.notes: Boutique lodging example to test lodging budget UI.

activities.name: Hierve el Agua (natural springs)
activities.notes: Petrified waterfalls; >25 mi from Centro (eligible only with Extended range).

activities.name: Árbol del Tule (Montezuma Cypress)
activities.notes: Ancient Montezuma cypress in Santa María del Tule.

activities.name: Mercado Benito Juárez
activities.notes: Traditional central market across from 20 de Noviembre. Town shop – browsing only; authenticity varies.

activities.name: Tlacolula Sunday Market
activities.notes: Vast weekly tianguis with food, textiles, barbacoa (Sundays). Town shop – browsing only; authenticity varies.

activities.name: IAGO – Instituto de Artes Gráficas de Oaxaca
activities.notes: Graphic arts institute and library founded by Francisco Toledo.

activities.name: Museo de Arte Prehispánico Rufino Tamayo
activities.notes: Pre‑Hispanic art collection curated by Rufino Tamayo.

activities.name: Centro de las Artes de San Agustín (CaSa)
activities.notes: Restored textile mill turned arts center with exhibits and views.

activities.name: Zona Arqueológica de Yagul
activities.notes: Zapotec site near Mitla; palace complex and ballcourt.

activities.name: Zona Arqueológica de Dainzú
activities.notes: Early Zapotec site with ballgame reliefs.

activities.name: Taller Jacobo y María Ángeles (Alebrijes)
activities.notes: Guided workshop visit in San Martín Tilcajete (copal wood alebrijes). Price guide (authentic alebrijes): small $150–500 MXN (~$8–30 USD); medium $1,500–6,000 MXN (~$80–330 USD); large/collector $10,000+ MXN (~$550+ USD). Renowned for nahual‑inspired symbolism; top pieces at this studio can reach or exceed $100,000 MXN. Guaranteed authentic (direct master workshop and certified gallery).

activities.name: Ex Convento de Cuilápam de Guerrero
activities.notes: Open‑air Dominican complex; historic site west of Oaxaca.

activities.name: Santa María Atzompa – Green Clay Pottery
activities.notes: Village famous for green‑glazed pottery; family workshops.

activities.name: MEAPO – Museo Estatal de Arte Popular de Oaxaca
activities.notes: State folk‑art museum in San Bartolo Coyotepec (barro negro).

activities.name: Pueblos Mancomunados – Sierra Norte Trails
activities.notes: Community‑run ecotourism with hikes in cloud forest (Benito Juárez / Cuajimoloyas).

activities.name: Itanoní – Tortillería y Antojería
activities.notes: Heirloom‑corn tortillas and memelas in Col. Reforma.

activities.name: Terraza Los Amantes – Mezcal & Rooftop
activities.notes: Rooftop views near Santo Domingo; cocktails and mezcal.

activities.name: Pasillo de Humo – Grills Row
activities.notes: Choose your meats and grill inside Mercado 20 de Noviembre.

activities.name: Templo de Santo Domingo de Guzmán (Church)
activities.notes: Iconic baroque church next to the Ethnobotanical Garden.

activities.name: Basílica de Nuestra Señora de la Soledad
activities.notes: Historic basilica and plaza on Av. Independencia.

activities.name: Teotitlán del Valle – Weaving Workshop
activities.notes: Family-run Zapotec weaving demonstrations; buy direct.

activities.name: Capulálpam de Méndez – Pueblo Mágico
activities.notes: Mountain village in the Sierra Norte; traditional medicine center and workshops.

activities.name: San Sebastián de las Grutas – Caves
activities.notes: Limestone cave system and river; off-the-beaten path.

activities.name: Zaachila – Thursday Market
activities.notes: Weekly tianguis with produce, prepared foods, crafts (Thursdays). Town shop – browsing only; authenticity varies.

activities.name: Lagunas de Chacahua National Park
activities.notes: Coastal mangroves, boat tours, birding.

activities.name: Laguna de Manialtepec (Bioluminescence)
activities.notes: Night bioluminescence tours near Puerto Escondido.

activities.name: Mazunte – Mexican Turtle Center
activities.notes: Centro Mexicano de la Tortuga and eco‑beaches.

activities.name: Casa Crespo – Cooking Classes
activities.notes: Market tour + hands-on classes; multiple themed menus.

activities.name: Casa de los Sabores – Chef Pilar Cabrera
activities.notes: Group class includes market tour, transport, mezcal tasting, recipes, and lunch.

activities.name: La Cocina Oaxaqueña – Cooking School
activities.notes: Master Class includes market visit; English-speaking staff; transport provided.

activities.name: Los Danzantes Oaxaca
activities.notes: Modern Mexican w/ Oaxacan flavors beside Santo Domingo.

activities.name: CRIOLLO (Chef Luis Arellano)
activities.notes: Seasonal Oaxacan cuisine; dining room + Casa Criollo.

activities.name: Levadura de Olla
activities.notes: Chef Thalía Barrios; Sierra Sur‑inspired menu.

activities.name: Origen
activities.notes: Chef Rodolfo Castellanos; seasonal menus.

activities.name: La Mezcalerita
activities.notes: Casual mezcal/beer bar with rooftop in Centro.

activities.name: Mezcalería In Situ
activities.notes: Renowned mezcal library; tastings by experts.

activities.name: Expendio Tradición
activities.notes: Design‑forward mezcal bar & restaurant (Reforma & Murguía).

activities.name: Txalaparta
activities.notes: Multi‑level bar/club w/ rooftop; frequent DJ sets.

activities.name: Selina Oaxaca Rooftop
activities.notes: Popular rooftop spot with wide views; tourist‑friendly.

activities.name: Traditional Oaxaca Cooking Class (Sonia Silva)
activities.notes: Hands-on class rooted in home-style Oaxacan cooking; often featured on Airbnb Experiences.

activities.name: Alma de Mi Tierra Cooking
activities.notes: Market tour + 4–5 hour class; mezcal tasting; recipes; classes in English or Spanish.

activities.name: Me Encanta Oaxaca — Cooking Class
activities.notes: Hands-on class in a local kitchen; traditional Oaxacan dishes.

activities.name: Quinta Brava — Farm-to-Table Class
activities.notes: Farm experience 10–15 min from Centro; transport included; tortillas, moles, salsas.

location.address: Nicolás Bravo 9, Santa Cruz Xoxocotlán, Oaxaca

activities.name: Pitiona
activities.notes: Modern Oaxacan tasting menus; terrace with cathedral views.

activities.name: Boulenc
activities.notes: Beloved bakery and restaurant; sourdough, sandwiches, brunch.

activities.name: Tierra del Sol Casa Restaurante
activities.notes: Chef Olga Cabrera; Mixtec-rooted cuisine; terrace dining; MICHELIN Bib Gourmand.

activities.name: La Olla
activities.notes: Chef Pilar Cabrera; longtime favorite for classic Oaxacan dishes.

activities.name: In Situ Mezcalería
activities.notes: Benchmark mezcal library and tastings in Centro.

activities.name: Selva Oaxaca Cocktail Bar
activities.notes: Art‑deco cocktail lounge known for mezcal-forward drinks.

activities.name: Aloha Oaxaca (Tiki Bar + Kitchen)
activities.notes: Tiki bar with mezcal riffs; casual, tourist‑friendly spot.

activities.name: Casa Porfirio
activities.notes: Rooftop‑leaning bar; mezcal, cocktails, DJ sessions; Centro location.

activities.name: Hotel Sin Nombre
activities.notes: Design-forward boutique hotel in a XVII‑century mansion.

activities.name: Casa Antonieta
activities.notes: Chic, intimate boutique stay near Santo Domingo.

activities.name: Escondido Oaxaca (Grupo Habita)
activities.notes: Design Hotels member; rooftop pool; contemporary-minimalist aesthetic.

activities.name: Pug Seal Oaxaca (Zapoteco)
activities.notes: Artful 19th‑century villa reimagined as boutique hotel.

activities.name: Andador Panorámico del Fortín (Auditorio Guelaguetza Loop)
activities.notes: Scenic pedestrian trail circling Cerro del Fortín with lookouts and access to Auditorio Guelaguetza; ideal for morning walks.

location.address: Cerro del Fortín / Auditorio Guelaguetza, Oaxaca

activities.name: Parque Juárez El Llano
activities.notes: Large green park with fountains, vendors, and shade; lively local scene and frequent cultural events.

location.address: Av. Benito Juárez s/n, Centro, Oaxaca

activities.name: Parque El Tequio (Bosque El Tequio)
activities.notes: Forested city park with long jogging paths; nature immersion on Oaxaca’s south side.

location.address: Bosque El Tequio, Santa Cruz Xoxocotlán, Oaxaca

activities.name: Cerro del Crestón Trail (Mirador & Benito Juárez Monument)
activities.notes: Uphill trail through a small reserve to a viewpoint and monument with panoramic valley views.

activities.name: San Martín Tilcajete — Alebrije Workshops
activities.notes: Village known for brightly painted alebrijes (mythical wood carvings). Family workshops demonstrate carving and painting. Price guide (authentic alebrijes): small $150–500 MXN (~$8–30 USD); medium $1,500–6,000 MXN (~$80–330 USD); large/collector $10,000+ MXN (~$550+ USD). Many workshops here feature nahual‑style (human–animal spirit) carvings. Guaranteed authentic (village workshops).

activities.name: Arrazola — Alebrije Workshops
activities.notes: Birthplace of Oaxacan alebrijes. Artisans carve copal wood and paint intricate details. Price guide (authentic alebrijes): small $150–500 MXN (~$8–30 USD); medium $1,500–6,000 MXN (~$80–330 USD); large/collector $10,000+ MXN (~$550+ USD). Classic styles are common; some workshops also carve nahual‑inspired figures. Guaranteed authentic (village workshops).

activities.name: San Bartolo Coyotepec — Barro Negro Pottery
activities.notes: Village famous for black clay ceramics pioneered by Doña Rosa. Family studios often give demonstrations.

activities.name: Teotitlán del Valle — Zapotec Weaving & Natural Dyes
activities.notes: Zapotec village famous for rugs (tapetes), cochineal dye demonstrations, and weaving cooperatives. English tours available.

activities.name: Santa María Atzompa — Green Pottery
activities.notes: Village near Monte Albán known for distinctive green-glazed barro verde pottery. Workshops and kilns open to visitors.

activities.name: Levadura de Olla Restaurante
activities.notes: Traditional Oaxacan with heirloom corn and indigenous herbs.

activities.name: Ancestral Cocina Tradicional
activities.notes: Upscale focus on indigenous ingredients and traditional preparations.

activities.name: La Popular Comedor
activities.notes: Beloved spot for tlayudas, casual but high quality.

activities.name: El Destilado
activities.notes: Experimental tasting menus and mezcal pairing flights.

activities.name: Archivo Maguey
activities.notes: Mezcal/cocktail bar with strong design aesthetic.

activities.name: Pulquería Mayahuel
activities.notes: Pulque and curados (fruit-flavored pulque); very local vibe, tourist-friendly.

activities.name: MAYORDOMO Cacao Workshop
activities.notes: Hands-on demo; grind cacao, cinnamon, sugar on a metate; prepare chocolate drink.

activities.name: Hernández Cacao y Chocolate Workshop
activities.notes: Bean-to-bar process: sourcing, roasting, grinding; tasting included.

activities.name: Reyes Etla Quesillo Cooperative
activities.notes: Dairy collective tour: milking, curdling, stretching quesillo; tastings. Transport recommended.

activities.name: San Agustín Etla Dairy Visits
activities.notes: Visits to local queserías near the Centro de las Artes; fresh quesillo traditions. Transport recommended.

activities.name: Festival Jazzatlán Oaxaca (Jazz Festival)
activities.notes: Annual jazz festival with concerts across Oaxaca City venues. Expected early April 2026 (dates tbc).

activities.name: Feria de Alebrije (Tilcajete)
activities.notes: Annual alebrije fair in San Martín Tilcajete every April, with artisans, food, music, and theatre. Guaranteed authentic (village workshops).

activities.name: Alebrije Carving & Painting Workshops (Tilcajete)
activities.notes: Hands-on alebrije carving and painting with local artisans (e.g., Dante Cruz). Price guide (authentic alebrijes): small $150–500 MXN (~$8–30 USD); medium $1,500–6,000 MXN (~$80–330 USD); large/collector $10,000+ MXN (~$550+ USD). Expect to see nahual‑style carvings among workshop pieces. Guaranteed authentic (village workshops).

activities.name: Weaving & Textile Workshop (Mitla)
activities.notes: Zapotec weaving and embroidery workshops in Mitla, using natural dyes.

location.address: San Pablo Villa de Mitla, Oaxaca

activities.name: Pluma Hidalgo Coffee Plantation Tour
activities.notes: Coffee plantation tour in the Sierra Sur. Learn about growing, roasting, and tasting Pluma coffee. Tours offered by local cooperatives; transport required.

activities.name: Oaxacan Mole Tasting & Workshop
activities.notes: Market tour followed by a mole-focused cooking class, highlighting multiple traditional varieties.

activities.name: Tlacolula Market Nieves Stalls
activities.notes: Traditional nieves and ice creams alongside breads and moles at the famous Tlacolula market. Town shop – browsing only; authenticity varies.

activities.name: Museo de Nieves Manolo
activities.notes: Iconic shop in Centro dedicated to traditional nieves, with dozens of flavors.

activities.name: Paleteria Popeye
activities.notes: Beloved Centro spot for nieves, paletas, and fruit-based ice creams.

activities.name: Getting Alebrijes Home Safely
activities.notes: Tips for transporting alebrijes to Austin: Small pieces – carry-on, wrapped in clothing or bubble wrap. Medium – double-wrap and box, then pack inside checked luggage with padding. Large collector pieces – ask workshop for DHL/FedEx insured shipping. Declare as 'wooden handicraft souvenir' at customs; finished copal wood carvings are permitted.

activities.name: Honchos – Casa de Churros
activities.notes: Fresh made-to-order churros; sauces like Mexican chocolate and strawberry. Reforma/Centro area. (Coords added for map display; verify pin if needed.)

location.address: Heroica Escuela Naval Militar 318, Reforma, Oaxaca de Juárez

activities.name: Sr. Churro
activities.notes: Classic crispy-outside, soft-inside churros; Centro location. (Coords added for map display; verify pin if needed.)

location.address: Av. Independencia 500, Centro, Oaxaca de Juárez

activities.name: Churros y Donna Eil Vega
activities.notes: Cozy Centro bakery; churros with champurrado or café. (Coords added for map display; verify pin if needed.)

location.address: Valerio Trujano 425, Centro, Oaxaca de Juárez

activities.name: La ChurroCleta
activities.notes: Popular street-style stand; typically found around Centro in the evenings. (Roving stand; location varies. Pin set near Jardín Conzatti.)

activities.name: Kiyo Café
activities.notes: Cozy, laptop‑friendly café; espresso & chai; alt milks.

activities.name: Cafebre
activities.notes: Minimalist café; good light; toasts & salads.

activities.name: Sagrado Filemón | Pan y Café
activities.notes: Two‑floor café; espresso drinks & full breakfast menu.

activities.name: Café Brújula (Alcalá)
activities.notes: Courtyard café; popular with travelers; calm ambiance.

activities.name: Pan con Madre (Bakery)
activities.notes: European‑style sourdoughs & pastries; backyard seating.

activities.name: Café Los Cuiles
activities.notes: Cozy spot near Jardín Carbajal; breakfasts & coffee.

activities.name: Café SL28
activities.notes: Tiny specialty café; pour‑overs & quiet vibe.

activities.name: Cafeto & Baristas
activities.notes: Local roaster; charming setting; brownies & pastries.

activities.name: Café El Volador
activities.notes: Small café; house‑roasted beans; homemade cakes.

activities.name: Carnaby Street Coffee
activities.notes: Hidden gem in a quiet plaza; relaxed for reading.
